pointOfView: An air of over-confidence has turned to intrepidation for many teeing off the 1st hole at Gray's Crossing. At first glance, it appears to be straight-forward, with wide fairways and large greens begging for hefty swings and fearlessly lashed at approach shots. You'll quickly understand why caution will win the day, however. Yes, the greens are big and generous access points reward accuracy, but you'll find that there are secrets to be known to make for a low round. Many greens are spined with unforgiving fall-aways over the back, and sloped landing zones off the tee can turn an apparent beauty into a sagebrush-laden nightmare of a recovery shot. Many tee shots are smartly played with less than driver, as landing zone runouts will find native areas unseen from tee boxes. Without doubt though, there are numerous opportunities for sub-par scores if played with caution. A reachable Par 4 on each side offers solace to the other beautiful, longer holes throughout the course. All Par 5s are reachable and are birdie opportunities, less hole 18, which takes two monster shots to clear the native beranka. In any case of success or struggle, you'll enjoy every minute of your round at Gray's Crossing, especially as you reflect on it while sipping a frosty draft on the deck at PJs, Gray's Crossing's lovely bar restaurant that overlooks the 18th hole and Mt. Rose beyond.

Designed around soaring pines and undisturbed wetlands, the course has tight yet forgiving fairways, 83 bunkers, water on three holes and subtle elevation changes. Its natural, native beauty and expansive views of Mt. Rose and the Sierra Nevada Mountain ranges set the backdrop for an idyllic, walkable round.

This Jim Hardy and Peter Jacobsen-designed masterpiece demands a combination of creative club choices and tactical strategies that call on golfers of all levels to expand their relationship with the game. Award-winning agronomists keep the course playing in tournament conditions all season long.

featuredHole.title: Hole #13 — Par 4
featuredHole.description: A beautiful par 4 with the Truckee River running along the left side. The approach demands precision with water lurking. The mountain views from this hole are quintessential Truckee.

testimonials.quote: Booked Gray’s Crossing Golf Course as part of a 3-course package with Golf the High Sierra. This was the standout round. Great elevation changes, strategic bunkering, and the staff couldn't have been more welcoming to our group of 20.

testimonials.quote: Gray’s Crossing Golf Course delivers every time. This was our third trip and the course keeps getting better. Par 3s are memorable, greens are quick and true. Best value for championship golf in the Truckee, CA area.
